result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey James Lehman

defendant.name: Lehman, Jeffrey James
defendant.address: 19054 Sand Hill Rd, Gays Mills, WI 54631

records.addlTxt:
3:31 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jeffrey James Lehman appeared by phone.  Attorney Charlotte M Wynes in court for Jeffrey James Lehman.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Wynes is heard and they're prepared to go forward with the preliminary hearing. 

1W - K. Mezera, sworn
Exam by Attorney Steiner 
Cross by Attorney Wynes

State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. Attorney Wynes is heard and objects to bind over. Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings.
Arraignment scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

1:31 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jeffrey James Lehman appeared by video.  Attorney Charlotte M Wynes appeared by video for Jeffrey James Lehman.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Wynes is heard. Felony case, need to schedule a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
The Adjourned Initial Appearance has been moved from 10:30 AM on 10/18/22 to 1:30 PM at the request of SPD counsel due to a time conflict.  To be held by Zoom.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:06 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jeffrey James Lehman appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is heard on the status of retaining an Attorney. Needs more time.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:52 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Jeffrey James Lehman in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Def. provided with a copy of the criminal complaint at this time

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Case recalled 2:13 PM
Questions by Defendant re: retrieving his personal belongings from property
Response by Court.  Bond already allowed for him to return in presence of law enforcement to retrieve his belongings.
Court clarifies def. cannot go to property of MD except in the presence of law enforcement - whether or not MD is present
Adjourned initial appearance on October 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:06 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jeffrey J Lehman appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Holevoet appeared via video. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant shall have no contact with MD.

Attorney Holevoet is heard. Requests a signature bond. 

Court orders a $500.00 signature bond. Defendant shall have no contact with MD.  Defendant may go to the residence that is shared with MD accompanied by Law Enforcement to get belongings. 

Court advises right to attorney.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant shall have no contact with MD.  Defendant may go to the residence that is shared with MD accompanied by Law Enforcement to get belongings.
